Crimes.Dispute_Type: Persecution and harm due to targeted threats
Crimes.Aggravating_Factors: History of gang violence and police corruption
Crimes.Evidence_Sufficiency: Sufficient – credible evidence of targeted threats
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Testimonial and documentary evidence of threats
Crimes.Evidence_Credibility: Credible – accepted by the Court as reasonable
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Applicants deemed credible by the Court
Crimes.Risk_Assessment: Particularized risk not shared by general population
Crimes.Targeted_Victimization: Yes – repeated threats from known officers
Crimes.Geographic_Context: Urban areas in the Philippines with high police corruption
Crimes.Applicable_Statute: IRPA sections 96 (refugee protection) and 97 (protection based on danger)
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: Section 96 – Convention refugee; Section 97 – person in need of protection
Crimes.Outcome: Board’s decision set aside, case remitted for re-determination
Crimes.Procedural_Issues: Failure to properly assess particularized risk
Crimes.Procedural_Stage: Judicial review of Refugee Appeal Division decision
Crimes.Legal_Procedure: Application for judicial review under Federal Courts Act
Crimes.Government_Body_Involved: Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Gender-based persecution and abuse of power
Crimes.Perpetrator_Type: Police officer in position of authority
Crimes.Victim_Status: Female applicant subjected to gender-based threats
Crimes.Threat_Source: Police officer involved in extortion and harassment
Crimes.Aggravating_Factors: Abuse of official power, ongoing threats
Crimes.Criminality_Severity: High – persistent sexual harassment and threats
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Mary Ann found credible by the Court
Crimes.Risk_Nature: Non-generalized, linked to social group (women subject to state abuse)
Crimes.Targeted_Victimization: Yes – directed at Mary Ann due to gender
Crimes.Geographic_Context: Philippines, where systemic gender-based violence exists
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: Section 96 – nexus to Convention grounds (membership in particular social group)
Crimes.Outcome: Board failed to consider gender-based persecution; case remitted
Crimes.Procedural_Issues: Failure to apply Gender Guidelines and assess nexus
Crimes.Procedural_Stage: Appeal stage before IRB, reviewed via judicial review
Crimes.Legal_Procedure: Judicial review challenging IRB's failure to analyze gender-based claim
Crimes.Government_Body_Involved: Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Violence related to extortion and police abuse
Crimes.Victim_Status: Family subjected to physical and psychological harm
Crimes.Threat_Source: Specific police officers engaged in extortion
Crimes.Aggravating_Factors: Use of official authority to intimidate and harm
Crimes.Evidence_Sufficiency: Sufficient – consistent accounts of violent encounters
Crimes.Targeted_Victimization: Yes – repeated attacks on same family
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: Section 96 – Convention refugee; Section 97 – danger of cruel treatment
Crimes.Procedural_Issues: Misclassification of personal risk as generalized
Crimes.Legal_Procedure: Judicial review under Federal Courts Act
Crimes.Government_Body_Involved: Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Extortion and abduction attempt by state actors
Crimes.Victim_Status: Family targeted for non-compliance with demands
Crimes.Threat_Source: Specific police officers involved in criminal enterprise
Crimes.Aggravating_Factors: Official capacity used to commit crime
Crimes.Evidence_Sufficiency: Sufficient – detailed account of attempted kidnapping
Crimes.Targeted_Victimization: Yes – specific attempt to abduct family member
Crimes.Targeted_Individual_Status: Victims of organized police extortion ring
Crimes.Geographic_Context: Philippines, environment of weak rule of law
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: Section 97 – risk of torture or cruel treatment
Crimes.Outcome: Board’s decision set aside, remanded for re-assessment
Crimes.Procedural_Issues: Failure to distinguish between generalized and personal risk
Crimes.Procedural_Stage: Judicial review after denial of refugee claim
Crimes.Government_Body_Involved: Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Failure to protect citizens reporting crimes
Crimes.Governing_Law: Principles of rule of law and access to justice
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Evidence of retaliation after filing complaint
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Board incorrectly dismissed claims as generalized
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicants to show particularized risk
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Consistency of testimony regarding police retaliation
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Risk must be personal, not general, to qualify for protection
Crimes.Outcome_on_Merits: Claim should have been assessed as particularized
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Unfair failure to assess individualized risk
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Pattern of threats following official complaint
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Generalized risk finding despite targeted threats
Crimes.Defendant_Response: No direct response from state actor
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Persecution and danger from state agents
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Rule of law and non-punishment for seeking justice

Crimes.Aggravating_Factors: Repeated demands, use of threats and violence
Crimes.Evidence_Credibility: Credible – consistent and supported by logic
Crimes.Risk_Nature: Targeted due to resistance to illegal demands
Crimes.Targeted_Victimization: Yes – specific financial and physical coercion
Crimes.Procedural_Issues: Failure to recognize particularized nature of risk
Crimes.Procedural_Stage: Refugee appeal and subsequent judicial review
Crimes.Government_Body_Involved: Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada

Crimes.Crime_Type: Human Rights Violations and Serious International Law Offenses
Crimes.Dispute_Type: State-sponsored abuse and lack of accountability
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Involved: Right to security of person, freedom from torture
Crimes.Outcome: Failure of state to protect its citizens
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Persecution by state agents due to refusal to comply with illegal demands
Crimes.Legal_Framework: International human rights law, Refugee Convention
Crimes.Institutional_Action: Police exploitation of power for personal gain
Crimes.Exemptions_or_Defenses_Cited: Widespread corruption justifies generalized risk assessment (rejected by Court)
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Affidavits, expert reports, country condition documentation
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Whether risk is personal vs. general
Crimes.Complaint_Issues: Lack of state protection against corrupt officials
Crimes.Grounds_for_Discrimination: Membership in particular social group (resisters of police extortion), gender
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Well-founded fear of persecution or danger
Crimes.Protection_Claim: Need for international protection due to state failure
Crimes.Victim_Basis: Resistance to illegal demands and gender
